seo.title: Best sunset viewpoints in Positano
seo.description: Top spots to watch the sunset in Positano, plus how to reach them on foot or by bus.

linkLabel: Sunset in Positano: Best Viewpoints for Golden Hour
intro: Sunsets in Positano are dramatic—choosing the right perch and timing makes the shot.
Use these reliable angles and arrival times to dodge the biggest crowds.

itemList.name: Chiesa Nuova terrace
itemList.note: Easy access near the SITA stop with sweeping bay views.

itemList.name: Via Positanesi d’America overlook
itemList.note: Balcony above Fornillo; arrive 30 minutes before sunset for warm light.

itemList.name: Nocelle (Path of the Gods start)
itemList.note: Faces the Li Galli islets—pack a layer for the ride back.

sections.title: Classic overlooks
body: Chiesa Nuova terrace offers a wide bay view steps from the SITA stop.
Via Positanesi d’America is a balcony above Fornillo—arrive 30 minutes before sunset for warm light.

sections.title: Quieter alternatives
body: Nocelle at the Path of the Gods trailhead faces the Li Galli islets; pack a layer for the ride back.
Fornillo beach outside peak weeks stays calmer; the sun hides behind the cliff so set up early.

sections.title: Timing your setup
body: Be in place 20 minutes before golden hour to claim a spot and dial in your settings.
Summer sunsets are around 20:30—check bus times so you’re not stranded after dark.

sections.title: Etiquette
body: Keep stairs and private entrances clear while you shoot—step aside once you have the frame.
Pack out trash and switch to silent mode during evening concerts or events.

tips: Arrive 20–30 minutes early to secure space and set up tripods without stress.
A light travel tripod or clamp is handy for blue-hour exposures when light fades.

a: Bars and rooftop terraces often require bookings in summer; public lookouts remain first-come, first-served.

faqs.q: Is there enough lighting for the walk back?
a: Street lighting varies—bring a phone torch or small light for late descents.
